title: refactor(core): extract EINTR-safe I/O helpers to SocketUtil
body:
## Summary
Move EINTR-safe read/write helpers from SocketHTTPClient.c to core/SocketUtil.h for codebase-wide reuse.

## Problem
EINTR retry loops are duplicated:
- `write_all_eintr()` at lines 2250-2268
- `read_all_eintr()` at lines 2271-2289

These are generic I/O patterns useful across the entire codebase.

## Location
- File: `src/http/SocketHTTPClient.c`
- Lines: 2250-2289

## Proposed Solution
Add to `include/core/SocketUtil.h`:
```c
ssize_t socket_util_write_all_eintr(int fd, const void *buf, size_t len);
ssize_t socket_util_read_all_eintr(int fd, void *buf, size_t len);
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Functions moved to SocketUtil.h as static inline or to SocketUtil.c
- [ ] SocketHTTPClient.c updated to use new helpers
- [ ] Other files checked for similar patterns that could use these
- [ ] Tests pass with sanitizers
- [ ] ~38 lines saved

## Labels
refactor, redundancy, core
